Reviews.Title: “Pretty poor, even for budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Petersrolex
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was something well below expectation. We understood that this was a budget hotel. Firstly the hairdryer was broken, the hose or pipe was torn, the staff tried to jam it back in there, but that was the only attempt. No alternative or compensation was offered. The door did not lock as it appeared that the door latch did not align properly with the door frame. The shower was tiny, plus the shower doors did not run on the tracks correctly meaning that they were unable to be closed completely. Towels were not replaced during our stay when we had requested it. Generally the room felt neglected, cracks in the walls and ceiling. Finally the breakfast was horrible, old stale rolls and very little of anything, Gernerally would not recommend this hotel, or keep your expectations very low.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome”
Reviews.Author: Yozilla
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, well positioned, clean rooms... Excellent and very helpful staff. The rooms are a bit chilly though the heating could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a short holiday”
Reviews.Author: maurotee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Luzzatti January 27 to 31 and it is right to indicate many positive reviews and some negative. Note doubt courtesy of the staff at any time of day or night, certainly the ideal location being close to the Manzoni Metro stop and the cost of the rooms. Among the negative judgments surely would put the size of the rooms are very small, decorated in the Gothic style, but regularly cleaned and conditioned for that purpose. Breakfast on continental standards and proportionate to the price paid for the accommodation. Ideal for groups of friends traveling with low cost and focused on the visit of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for undemanding tourists”
Reviews.Author: Viola A
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect place for tourists who come to visit Rome and are not going to stay in the hotel all day long: you have breakfast and then you go downtown for sight-seeing or shopping. A metro station and the railway station are not far. For entering the room you'll get a card, but only one, even if you are two. When you go somewhere, you must leave the card at the reception, but it is a usual practice in many other hotels. We could not find a good restaurant nearby, but I guess it was our fault that we did not really try. There is a supermarket very close to the hotel. The Italians do not eat much for breakfast, but the breakfast in the hotel was enough for us: thin slice of cheese and ham, a roll, a piece of cake, some juice, a yoghurt and coffee/tea. I just think that if you stay longer than one week, you want something different. Keep in mind that in Rome tourists pay tourist's fee - we paid 2 euros/per person/per day. We stayed in the hotel at the low-rate season and the price was really reasonable: 60 euros/per double room/per night. But if during "hot season" it is 150 euros as it is written in the room, I would say that it's expensive. In the rooms there are heaters, which was very comfortable. But when we opened the window at night, we got mosquitoes (which, of course, is not the hotel's fault!). For me the most important thing is staff's attitude, because if they are professional and friendly, you can solve any problem. In this hotel the personnel is very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ash77London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. It was close to Termini for which we choose it as we had plan to catch train to Venice. It is about 25 minutes by walk from Termini. The rooms were of medium size but clean. Toilets were clean as well. The staffs were pretty friendly and most of them speak workable English. Our rent of 65 Euro per night included breakfast but it was only croissant, cereal and coffee. It is close to underground station, Tram and Bus routes and there was a supermarket nearby. If you are on a budget, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Cheap, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soggiorno
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Luzzatti is what it is. It's not the Ritz. If you're expecting opulence or splendor you're in the wrong place. But it's clean, safe, relatively cheap and it's convenient to the Metro and to Roma Termini train station. The breakfast isn't much, but the coffee is good and it's fresh, and there's a nice little patio out the back to drink it on, and the service was very friendly and welcoming. The shower was clean, the TV worked, the A/C worked and the beds, though narrow, were fine. I stayed three separate times during July, for one night each time, and was uniformly pleased. We walked to Roma Termini the first time, and it was an easy stroll as we had little luggage. The hotel staff arranged a taxi for us to the airport that cost less than half what the meter said. I'd certainly stay there again, and probably will.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Founders81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is no thrill 2* hotel. The room was quite spacious and quiet. Bathroom had some mold-issues in the ceiling, but it did not bother us. Room was cleaned daily and towels changed daily. Cleaner did not tough any of our stuff, so I think cleaning was limited to making bed and changing towels. Breakfast was typical south-europian style, sweet cakes and coffee, but better than leaving with empty stomach. Front-staff didnt speak too much english, so don't expect any turist advices from them. There was English lonely planet to read in the lobby though. The location was ok, bit far away, but metro nearby. I think this was quite good value for our money in the city were hotels are not that cheap...

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel with huge breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MarieEva
Reviews.Content: It can be found easily, 5 minutes from metro station / 1 minute from bus or tram station. It is safe, rooms are normal, cleaned every day, air-conditioned. We had to fight mosquitos, so be ready to meet them there even in hot summer. When the windows were closed, the room was extremely quiet; we didn't even hear our neighbours. Shower very tiny, as usual in Italy. Staff very friendly, helpful, speaking English. Breakfast excellent - bread, croissants, ham, cheese, marmelades, honey, nutella, muslli, cornflakes, raisin danish, milk, orange juice, tea, coffee (latte, capucino). Supermarket across the street. Good, cheap restaurants with excellent local food and nice staff nearby. It was a very good choice - good price, good location, good service, ... If I am back to Rome, I'll be back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value for Money”
Reviews.Author: NdG13
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much at all from a 2 star hotel in Europe but my husband and I were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Hotel Luzzatti. It is 5 minutes walk from the Metro Station - Manzoni and has a really attractive entrance from the street. Conveniently it has a big supermarket just up the road and some little places to eat at. The area is generally not the nicest so we chose to eat dinner in the city centre where the main attractions are. Our room (#36) was really big and clean, we were quite happy with it. We also had a nice big bathroom with a lovely shower. We never had any problem with noise during our stay. The road can be noisy but we had the windows closed at night as it was quite cool and to stop mosquitos coming in. Breakfast was good and we were always promptly offerred coffee/tea/hot choc. The staff were friendly. This is by far the best 2 star hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very basic and mould in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: drinky_canberra
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Luzzatti in a standard room. Hotel is in a great location - walking distance from Termini for airport and regional trains, and 100m from the metro stop. The neighbourhood is quiet at night but we did not feel unsafe. There are a couple of restaurants around but better to walk down towards the colosseum. About a block before you get there on the left is a range of great trattoria, pasta around 6 Euro and mains 10 euro. The room was spartan (see photos) but actually quite large given other Italian offerings, there is actually space for you to unpack and there is a safe in the wardrobe. The 'queen' bed was actually two singles pushed together with a queen spread, not entirely comfortable but you will sleep on it if tired. There is a TV with BBC and italian channels, enough to catch up on news. Mould in the bathroom, but thankfully not on any surface we were touching (mainly above the toilet and shower screen, see photo). Does not inspire confidence about the cleaning. It would probably help the 'humidity' if they installed a exhaust fan. The man on the check-in desk was very helpful, giving us a map and pointing out the best way to get to everything. No other services on-site, but laundromats and internet hubs close by. Breakfast was disappointing, they had blood orange juice from concentrate, worst croissants I've ever had (we'd just come from France), cereal, tea and coffee, not much else. Would have preferred a loaf of bread and some jam! Overall this place is passable but not good value, we paid 100 euro per night in what should be shoulder season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cheekie08
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Hotel was basic but very clean. Room was a reasonable size. Staff were very firendly and helpful. There was a metro station which was about 5 minutes walk from hotel and you could walk to the Colosseum from the hotel in about 20 minutes. Security in the hotel was also good. There was a safety deposit box in our room and the gate at the front of the hotel was always locked so no-one could get into the hotel unless someone at reception buzzed them in.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: natlus
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights in a family room at this hotel and couldn't fault it. It was a huge room with one queen and two single beds and still heaps of room. It was nicely decorated with a clean bathroom. The shower was typical Italian, a bit smallish but fine. The room had a safe and air con. The breakfast was a bit basic but the staff were all very nice and helpful. Our stay was much better than I expected so was pleasantly surprised. It is a bit of a job to find it though from the Termini, so getting there via the Manzoni tube station is by far the best bet. Great, well priced accommodation, especially for a family of four. There was a supermarket virtually right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rachel003
Reviews.Content: Great value for Rome in the summer.(Small room, no lift, no english language CNN or anything, but reasonable price and very convenient.) Staff was great. Great gelato nearby, too!

Reviews.Title: “Near Historic Rome, quieter side street, close to Termini and Metro.”
Reviews.Author: Polyglot_xy
Reviews.Content: Narrow, vertical hotel with nice staff and the best breakfast of our 3 hotels in Italy. Our room and bath were fine--not over-roomy, but very clean and in very good condition. The value is good--comparable to other prices for the room and breakfast. Upon arrival, we took a taxi from Termini train station because directions were hard to understand and we had bags (10 circuitous minutes, less than $20US). Afterwards, we walked or got Metro day passes. Termini is the best location for any tours you may want to explore by bus, open-air bus, or walking guides. It's also central for city buses; see the info kiosk in the bus-slotted departure/arrival yard in front of the main Termini foot thoroughfare.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Spartan, but a good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: PandaPaws
Reviews.Content: I have to preface my comments by mentioning that we stayed just one night at this hotel, and it was the night after we arrived in Rome from California, so anything resembling a bed was looking pretty attractive. As others have mentioned, the hotel is in a slightly seedy part of town, but it seemed safe enough. There was a good gelateria nearby, and it was fun to be in a real neighborhood rather than the usual tourist areas. It is a short walk from the Metro station, on a quiet side street. We wished we had had more time so we could have taken advantage of the pleasant courtyard in the back. Breakfast was fine, though not particularly memorable. The desk clerks and other staff were very pleasant. Our room was on the second floor (what we in the US call the third), and was rather spartan, no luxuries nor decorations. I did comment at the time that it is perhaps no worse to have nothing on the walls than to have some of the trash that passes for decor in many hotels I have visited. The room was clean, and everything was functional, but the peeling paint in the bathroom gave a poor impression. The air conditioner worked a little too well and we weren't able to figure out how to adjust it, so we had to resort to a on or off strategy. All in all, I thought the place was a good value for the money, as Rome seems very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “staying in luzzatti hotel, rome”
Reviews.Author: pocci
Reviews.Content: i spent with my husband two nights in luzzatti hotel in rome this april. well, it is not a fancy hotel, and it is not in a very good aera, but so is also the price.....but, i must say that the room was very clean, breakfast was fresh and good and the service and the attitude of the people of the hotel were very good ans we left the hotel with warm feelings. thank you very much, the people in luzzetti hotel. you are running a small hotel but you are very prpfessional and helping.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Luzzatti”
Reviews.Author: kersan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luzzatti for 4 nights in September 2006 and the last night of my stay in Italy in October 2006. It is simply the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The single standard room I booked (#110) was on the second floor and there was no lift, I had to drag my bag up the stairs. The room was a dog box, hot and awful. The Manager did not have an electric fan that I could use until he suddenly remembered where one was after I gave him an Australian calander. That did make life a bit more beaerable. The bed itself was ok but the single pillow supplied was no more than 2 inches thick. I had to beg for another one and on my last night in October I had to put up with a heavy lumpy thing because the Hotel did not have a spare pillow because "they were fully booked that night" The copious quanties of black mould in the bathroom is a testament to the disgusting level of the cleaning in this Hotel. In addition to the mould, on the last night in October there were nasty stains on the floor just inside the door and under the shower that were not there during my earlier stay. The shower is a joke. It is a shower head in the ceiling that sprays the water all over the bathroom and the toilet seat and you have to mop it up with towels after you use it otherwise you tread water everywhere. At times I had to have it running flat out for 10 minutes before some luke warm water eventually flowed through. The big 2 way shower tap is located in a stupid place on the wall. Twice whilst walking past it to get to the toilet I accidently knocked it on and got drenched. The noise coming in the room from the nearby Via Manzoni and the noise from the corridor and ajoining rooms is simply awful. It is impossible to sleep properly even with ear plugs. The only good points about this Hotel are the staff are nice, especially Luigi who was really good to me, and the fact that there are 2 really good supermarkets only about a 3 minute walk away. The rate of 50 Euros a night for the single standard room is good for Rome but I really wonder if this dump of a Hotel is even worth that. I would never recomment the Luzzatti to anyone and would never stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Luzzatti
HotelInfo.Address: Via Luigi Luzzatti, 3, 00185 Rome, Italy
